SEARCH

Package org.ddolib.examples.alp

package org.ddolib.examples.alp
The Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) requires to schedule the landing of a set of aircraft 𝑁= {0,...,𝑛−1} on a set of runways 𝑅 = {0,...,𝑟−1}. The aircraft have a target time 𝑇_𝑖 that gives the earliest landing time, and latest landing time 𝐿_𝑖. Moreover, the set of aircraft is partitioned in disjoint sets 𝐴_0,...,𝐴_{c-1} corresponding to different aircraft classes in 𝐶= {0,...,𝑐−1}. For each pair of aircraft classes 𝑎,𝑏 ∈ 𝐶, a minimum separation time 𝑆𝑎,𝑏 between the landings is given. The goal is to find a feasible schedule that contains all the aircraft and minimizes the total waiting time of the aircraft – the delay between their target time and scheduled landing time – while respecting their latest landing time.
  • Related Packages

    Description
    org.ddolib.examples
    Package containing examples
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    ALPAcsMain
    ######### Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) ############# Main class to solve the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) using the Anytime Column Search (ACS) algorithm.
    ALPAstarMain
    ######### Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) ############# Main class to solve the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) using the A* search algorithm.
    ALPDdoMain
    ######### Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) ############# Main class to solve the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) using the Dynamic Decision Diagram (DDO) approach.
    ALPDecision
    Represents a decision in the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP).
    ALPFastLowerBound
    Fast lower bound computation for the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP).
    ALPProblem
    Represents the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP).
    ALPRanking
    Ranking heuristic for ALPState objects in the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP).
    ALPRelax
    Relaxation operator for ALPState in the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP).
    ALPState
    Represents the state of the Aircraft Landing Problem (ALP) at a given moment.
    RunwayState
    State of a runway : last landing time and last aircraft's class
